intro: Lycianthes sideroxyloides var. transitoria, commonly known as the Transitory Lycianthes, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gardens. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticultural and ecological studies.
